projectGridLines.title: Impact of climatic change and other drivers on food security and its sustainability
projectGridLines.description:
Description: 

The agriculture sector is particularly susceptible to the impacts of climate change. The increasing effects of climate change not only influence food production, but also impact all the dimensions of food security, including the availability, access, utilization, and stability of food. The ICRISAT-OLM initiatives are intended to improve the livelihoods of farmers and rural households by assessing the impact of climate change on food security through two different methods: FMEA (Failure Mode and Effect Analysis) and Household Dietary Diversity Score. The Data Fellow will employ advanced statistical methods such as the panel data regression model, logit model, and GIS analysis to determine the effects of changing climate on household-level food security.



Skill sets:

  • Knowledge of advanced inferential statistics
  • Knowledge of machine learning methods
  • Familiarity with open-source GIS/satellite mapping tools
  • Proficiency with R, Python, or any other statistical programming languages
  • Data visualization


Traits expectation: 

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills 
  • Good verbal, written, and presentation skills


Expected learning:

  • Immersive opportunity to apply data science to real-world problem statements in the field of climate change and health


Specific courses required for project execution:  

  • Any advanced statistics/data science course

projectGridLines.title: A Scientometric Exploration of Climate Change's Effects on Food and Nutrition Security in India Using Open-Access Web Data
projectGridLines.description:
Description: 

This project seeks to generate critical evidence on the social impact problem or challenge of understanding and quantifying the effect of climate change on food security and nutrition in India. Which is key to designing effective climate adaptation policies. By analyzing the open-access web data from multiple sources, the goal would be to contribute valuable insights into the interconnected issues of climate change, food security (availability, accessibility, utilization, and stability), and nutritional challenges. This research aims to inform strategies and policies that can mitigate the adverse social impacts of climate change on food security and nutrition in the Indian context. The methodology for this involves leveraging the Digital Methods epistemology. The approach considers web and social media activities as proxies for broader public discourse and engagement.

kill sets:

  • Familiarity with query languages (e.g., SQL)
  • Data manipulation and analysis using tools like Python or R
  • Statistical analysis skills
  • Web scraping
  • Network modeling and visualization
  • Natural Language Processing (NLP)
  • Knowledge of machine learning algorithms (optional, depending on the research scope)
  • Basic knowledge of climate change and social science


Traits expectation: 

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills 
  • Good verbal, written, and presentation skills


Expected learning:

  • Immersive opportunity to apply data science to real-world problem statements in the field of climate change and health


Specific courses required for project execution:  

  • Any advanced statistics/data science course
